Reasoning by the JUF Theory for
Working Example(continued)
• However, according to the JUF theory, if one of the following
counter-arguments is proved by the defendant, the desired con-
clusion is not obtained.
– The plaintiﬀgave the defendant permission by Phrase 1.
– The defendant did not abuse the conﬁdence of the plaintiﬀac-
cording to the above Supreme Court case rule.
• However, according to the JUF theory, even if there are some facts
related to a non-abuse of conﬁdence, the plaintiﬀcan challenge de-
fendant’s counter-argument if the plaintiﬀgave other facts related
to the destructin of conﬁdence.
